How to Install html2text on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • html2text

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install html2text on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing html2text on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall html2text in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install html2text, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install html2text Using apt

To install html2text in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install html2text using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install html2text

The installation of html2text might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install html2text Using apt-get

To install html2text using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install html2text.

sudo apt-get -y install html2text

Install html2text Using Synaptic

To install html2text using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install html2text on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for html2text. This will display the html2text package in the package window, now to install html2text, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the html2text package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of html2text.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install html2text Using aptitude

To install html2text on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of html2text.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install html2text using the command aptitude install html2text.

sudo aptitude -y install html2text

How to Upgrade html2text on debian

If you want to upgrade the html2text package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade html2text using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade html2text to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade html2text.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade html2text sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade html2text

Upgrade html2text using Aptitude

To upgrade html2text using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade html2text.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade html2text

Upgrade html2text using Synaptic

To upgrade html2text using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for html2text, now right-click html2text, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade html2text just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall html2text on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall html2text from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just html2text, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove html2text

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of html2text

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of html2text you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge html2text

Remove html2text using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall html2text using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for html2text, right-click the html2text package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall html2text click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install html2text on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade html2text using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of html2text then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
